subject: Using TestResult and accessing its methods
msgSnippet: Hi! I am a beginner JUnit user, and I am not able to find sufficient information in the Documentation on how to use the TestRunner class and access its
messageBody:
Hi!

I am a beginner JUnit user, and I am not able to find sufficient
information in the Documentation on how to use the TestRunner class and
access its methods.

There are a few examples in
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm, under "Suite", but
I'm still unsure how to use TestRunner.

For example, (how) can I access the TestRunner's methods in the tearDown()
method of a TestCase subclass? Say that I want to avoid deleting some
generated output files if a test has failed (but delete them if the test
is successful).

The methods wasSuccessful(), failureCount() and errorCount() in
junit.framework.TestResult look very convenient to use. Is this true?

I guess I could use some modified version of what is suggested in the
thread http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/13151 ("detect test
failure in teardown()"), but I want to know more about TestResult first...

--
John
